intro: Manulea aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian manulea, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
